line_2: Devout, on high she rais'd her lucid eyes,

line_1: On some fond breast the parting soul relies,
line_2: Ev'n from the tomb the voice of Nature cries,

line_1: May he, on whom her hope relies,
On Arms like these the Fishing Swain relies.
line_2: Are all the Tools his constant Toil employs;

line_1: But on sharp Teeth, and horny Snout relies.
line_2: With them the Sea-Mouse roves of slender Size,

line_1: On your support our anxious Bard relies,
line_2: And hopes to take his plaudits from your eyes;

line_1: On some fond breast the parting soul relies,
line_2: Ev'n from the tomb the voice of nature cries,

line_1: On Her Resolves the Western World relies,
line_2: To BRITTAIN'S QUEEN the Nations turn their Eyes,

line_1: But she on public candour firm relies,
line_2: "Vain are her hopes," the snarling critic cries;
Again forlorn from rebel arms she flies,
